    NLSolversBase.gradient — Function.

    Evaluates the gradient value at x

    This does not update obj.DF or obj.x_df.

    Get the most recently evaluated gradient of obj.

    Get the ith element of the most recently evaluated gradient of obj.

    NLSolversBase.gradient! — Function.

    Evaluates the gradient value at x.

    Stores the value in obj.DF.

    NLSolversBase.gradient!! — Function.

    Force (re-)evaluation of the gradient value at x.

    Stores the value in obj.DF.

    NLSolversBase.nconstraints — Function.
    nconstraints(bounds) -> nc

    The number of linear/nonlinear constraint functions supplied by the user. This does not include bounds-constraints on variables.

    See also: nconstraints_x.

    NLSolversBase.nconstraints_x — Function.
    nconstraints_x(bounds) -> nx

    The number of "meaningful" constraints (not ±Inf) on the x coordinates.

    See also: nconstraints.

    NLSolversBase.parse_constraints — Function.
    parse_constraints(T, l, u) -> eq, val, ineq, σ, b

    From user-supplied constraints of the form

    l_i ≤  v_i  ≤ u_i

    (which include both inequality and equality constraints, the latter when l_i == u_i), convert into the following representation:

    - `eq`, a vector of the indices for which `l[eq] == u[eq]`
- `val = l[eq] = u[eq]`
- `ineq`, `σ`, and `b` such that the inequality constraints can be written as
         σ[k]*(v[ineq[k]] - b[k]) ≥ 0
   where `σ[k] = ±1`.

    Note that since the same v_i might have both lower and upper bounds, ineq might have the same index twice (once with σ=-1 and once with σ=1).

    Supplying ±Inf for elements of l and/or u implies that v_i is unbounded in the corresponding direction. In such cases there is no corresponding entry in ineq/σ/b.

    T is the element-type of the non-Int outputs

    NLSolversBase.showeq
    NLSolversBase.showineq
    NLSolversBase.symmetrize
    NLSolversBase.value — Function.

    Evaluates the objective value at x.

    Returns f(x), but does not store the value in obj.F

    Get the most recently evaluated objective value of obj.

    NLSolversBase.value! — Function.

    Evaluates the objective value at x.

    Returns f(x) and stores the value in obj.F

    NLSolversBase.value!! — Function.

    Force (re-)evaluation of the objective value at x.

    Returns f(x) and stores the value in obj.F
